results.title: Demand Generation Manager
results.description:
We're Apogee. Nice to meet you. At our core, we're an IT-services organization that happens to focus on higher education. We touch the lives of binge-watching, music-loving, game-playing, finals-taking, seminar-attending, class-selecting students by providing IT infrastructure that meets today's needs technology-savvy generation.

We work hard, celebrate success, and challenge everyone in our organization to be a problem solver. If you are as passionate as we are about the intersection of technology and education, join us today.

Apogee is searching for a talented marketing professional to nurture leads and present our managed IT services compellingly and thoughtfully.

They'll use email marketing and account-based marketing (ABM) tactics to engage with and advance prospects through the lead lifecycle.

Driven, enthusiastic, and innovative in their approach, the ideal candidate will leverage marketing automation (MAS) and ABM software to identifying buying intent and engagement and uncover new opportunities early in the buying journey.

We are looking for a gritty, high achiever who embraces challenges, goals, and performances metrics and is interested in having a direct impact on a high-growth company with a history of challenging the status quo in higher education.

This person will sit in marketing and closely collaborate with the sales team.

Apogee is headquartered in Austin, TX and we're open to hiring remotely for this position.

The salary range for the position is $75,000-$80,000 depending on experience.

You will:

  • Create the strategy, produce the assets (emails, landing pages, etc.), and build the programs for point-in-time and automated/triggered programs in Marketo to nurture leads.
  • Understand how best to leverage our technologies ‚Äì Marketo, Demandbase, and Salesforce CRM ‚Äì to aid in lead nurturing programs.
  • Analyze and understand the segments and profiles of our contacts database.
  • Track weekly performance metrics by program against monthly, quarterly, and yearly targets for marketing-sourced contacts, marketing-influenced contacts, and opportunities generated from marketing-sourced contacts.
  • Test and optimize messaging, offers, and online experiences to drive the best conversion rates.
  • Communicate with sales and other stakeholders about the lead nurturing process.
  • Have a strategic mindset and ability to successfully design, assemble, and execute nurture flows for contacts from a variety of channels including events.
  • Plan and implement segmented email nurture streams that increase response rates and engagement and drive measurable pipeline while also determining qualification based on lead behavior and funnel stage progression.
  • Work closely with sales team to advance the most promising opportunities through the funnel.
  • Leverage experience with A/B and multivariate testing to continually optimize the impact of campaign efforts.
  • Define segmentation criteria to manage prospect lists by buyer persona and service line for nurture programs.
  • Map and document the nurture strategy, automation processes, programs, and procedures.

Ideal Candidate

  • A star at creating compelling email copy, including subject lines that get emails opened and CTAs that convert.
  • A Salesforce and Marketo guru that knows how to segment audiences and craft offers that appeal to different sales and marketing funnel stages.
  • Has a thorough understanding of the marketing funnel and lead and sales lifecycle.
  • A proactive self-starter, demonstrating high initiative and critical thinking. Proven ability to think strategically, but with exceptional attention to detail in execution.
  • Experience working in higher education at a college or university or vendor serving higher education.
  • Highly collaborative and organized and understands how programs integrate into overall marketing campaigns.

Requirements

  • BA/BS required.
  • 4+ years of experience in email marketing or similar field, with the desire to learn more about account-based marketing.
  • Samples of email copy and nurture streams required.
  • Demonstrated Salesforce and Marketo experience, certification is a plus.
  • Demandbase or 6sense experience is a plus.
  • Has both technical (marketing automation program structure) and creative skills (email copy, content topics, hosting webinars, etc.).
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and building things from the ground up.
  • Ambitious, eager, and fun!

Benefits

Our employees enjoy benefits that make them more productive and contribute directly to the development of their professional skills. We want to be able to attract the best of the best and make sure they keep getting better so here is what we are offering:

  • An attractive salary
  • Health insurance plan including Health Savings Account matching program
  • Monthly technology stipend
  • Engineering and Technical teams receive cash bonuses for obtaining certifications
  • Maternity and Paternity leave
  • Peer recognition program
  • Career development programs

Diversity Commitment Statement

At Apogee, we believe education is a doorway to a fair and just society. Within our own walls, we stand committed to creating a healthy culture of diversity and inclusion, empowering one another as advocates for an inclusive workplace, and doing so transparently. Apogee employees founded three employee-led groups in 2020 including Diversity and Inclusion, Civic Awareness, and Apogee Veterans.

Accommodation Statement

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to Human Resources, hr@apogee.us.

results.title: Demand Generation Manager, ABM
results.description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?

Cloud Academy is a hyper-growth upskilling and reskilling SaaS company, focused on enabling enterprise customers to have full transparency and control over their tech workforce skills readiness. In a rapidly changing cloud technical landscape where there is an increasing tech skills gap in the market, combined with the difficulty organizations are facing to retain tech talent and the demands for numerous technical certifications, companies need the ability to manage these skills at scale more than ever. We help over 1000 customers visualize, assess, transform and measure their teams‚Äô tech skills readiness through a unique Skills Intelligence Platform, powered by world class cloud training content. Companies like Warner Media, Deloitte, JP Morgan Chase and Walmart trust Cloud Academy with their technical cloud skills readiness at scale, so they can achieve their cloud business goals.¬†¬†¬†

We are a global team, with colleagues in over 14 countries worldwide. We are a diverse team that is innovative, collaborative, pragmatic and passionate about making an impact. We thrive on a common vision, we obsess about our customers and learners, and we take pride in the quality of our work. Most importantly, we know that individually we are only as good as our teams are, and we always have each others‚Äô backs.¬†¬†



Job Description

We are seeking driven, highly competent, and creative team players to join us on the next phase of our growth story, as we scale our winning products to help even more customers and learners.

ROLE DESCRIPTION:

As the Account Based Marketing Manager, you will take a leading role in helping grow and scale our ABM program, a primary piece of our go-forward strategy to help us achieve our revenue goals. This will include planning/launching marketing campaigns, measuring their impact, and partnering closely with the sales team.

¬†

Responsibilities:

  • Strategize, execute, and optimize a ABM strategy to help achieve sales goals, with a key focus on attracting new business.
  • Develop and deploy multi-channel ABM campaigns, including crafting strategy, aligning internal teams, and executing
  • Apply an experimentation mindset to ABM campaigns to drive, test, learn, and optimize
  • Iterate and optimize campaigns based on data and analysis of ABM campaigns and tactics
  • Collaborate with ABM leadership team (sales and marketing interlock) to select key accounts
  • Provide ongoing reporting, campaign insights and pacing toward goal to stakeholders
  • Work closely with marketing ops and business ops to support high-performance ABM marketing tools and integrations
  • Partner closely with AEs to ensure strong marketing and sales alignment



Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience in account based marketing or similar field, with the desire to learn more about account based marketing strategy
  • Experience in Account Based Marketing for New Logo acquisition in the Enterprise B2B space
  • Highly organized and efficient with the ability to develop and execute against an evolving plan
  • Be bold, willing to try new things, and experiment on the edge!
  • Ability to clearly communicate new ideas, products, and campaigns to both internal and external stakeholders
  • Team player who is able to work both collaboratively and autonomously
  • Strong project management, time management, prioritization, and organizational skills
  • Experience managing and prioritizing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve results working cross-functionally with sales, marketing, and product teams
  • CRM/marketing automation background nice to have, preferably Salesforce and Hubspot
  • Proactive self-starter, demonstrating high initiative and critical thinking
  • Proven ability to think strategically, but with exceptional attention to detail in execution



Additional Information

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary with a bonus plan
  • 401(k) with a Company match
  • Full benefits, including medical, dental, and vision with Aetna
  • Four weeks of paid vacation per year (that increases to five weeks after two years with the company!
  • Paid public holidays, sick days and 1 day to volunteer at your favorite non-profit per year
  • 6 weeks of fully paid parental leave once you hit the one year mark - inclusive of all parents, birth or adoption (pro-rated for less than 1 year tenure)
  • Lots of opportunity for growth! We believe in promoting our great people

We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer at Cloud Academy. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Head of Marketing
results.description:

Our growth has been significant and sustained, recently recognised by Clutch as one of the Top B2B companies in the UK, we are constantly seeking top industry talent to join our team and grow our expertise.

Waracle adopt a remote first ethos and provide a set up allowance you can use towards a comfy chair or desk! We have office space available in Dundee, Edinburgh, Glasgow and London if you miss that buzz in the office. This role is a permanent position.

As our Head of Marketing, you‚Äôre a relationship-builder and creative mind, uncovering opportunities for positioning Waracle as a market-leading product digital consultancy. You will work across brand, campaigns and content to develop Waracles reputation among executives and decision makers and generating MQLs. You are a seasoned leader with excellent communication skills and love inspiring and coaching teams.

  • Extensive B2B marketing experience, ideally gained within the technology/technology consulting sectors

The recruitment process you can expect for this role is an initial call with your dedicated Talent Acquisition Partner who will chat with you about Waracle, what you are looking for in a new position, the salary for the role, notice period and benefits (the important stuff!). After that, will follow a 2 stage interview process where you have an opportunity to find out more about the role and show off your skills and experience. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will guide you through the whole process to your first day with us.

We love to have fun, make friends for life and spend time together outside of work! We have various events, days out, competitions and incentives throughout the year and here are some other benefits you can expect at Waracle.

results.title: Revenue Marketing Manager
results.description:
Developers Institute is a New Zealand owned business with a clear vision of solving the world's software engineering shortage by providing data-driven software development education.

We‚Äôre an ambitious scale-up in growth mode, on the lookout for like-minded people to join in on the journey and contribute to our vision of helping people succeed.

¬†

The Role

This is a Revenue Marketing Manager position like no other, working 100% remotely. You will be responsible for implementing strategy and delivering integrated campaigns while generating marketing leads and hitting revenue targets. We‚Äôre looking for a candidate with a growth mindset, a data-informed approach, and a drive to deliver results. You‚Äôll also be comfortable on the tools, whether its new platforms or programmes, you thrive on developing your skill set.

Reporting to the GM of Operations, you will be creating, managing and evolving a scalable marketing plan that achieves new customer pipeline and revenue targets across a mix of channels. You‚Äôre comfortable analysing data based customer insights and trends to pivot when necessary.

¬†

What you‚Äôll do

Benefits

  • Market Rates: Our people are paid market rate salaries

  • Equal Pay: Our people are paid equally in the same role
  • Development: Our people are trained, developed and upskilled
  • Recognition: We celebrate our people's success
  • Flexibility: Our people balance their work responsibilities and personal time
  • Remote Working: Our people have the freedom and support to work remotely
  • Parental Support: Our people are supported with paid parental leave

Applications Close - 5pm Friday 2nd of December 2022.

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
Reprise is the leading enterprise-ready product experience platform that enables sales and marketing teams to control the narrative of their demo/product experiences without needing engineering involvement. With Reprise, teams can create immersive, lightweight experiences of the product's key features, enabling customers to reach "wow" moments faster. Backed by ICONIQ Growth, Bain Capital Ventures, Accomplice VC, and Glasswing Ventures, Reprise is paving the way for full funnel product-led growth.

Founded in 2020 by a team of repeat founders, we're entering our next phase of growth and are building a team of talented individuals who are passionate about creating a new category of software while making Reprise the best place any of us has ever worked.

We value smarts, diversity, and drive. Smarts because we need people that can learn quickly. Diversity because it makes all of our decision-making better. And drive because we are fundamentally operators -- our bias is to get things done. Our foundational principles are such that we believe we have an obligation to conduct our business in a way that advances social good.

Even if you do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed below, please consider applying anyway. We will consider candidates that do not meet all of the listed requirements.

About The Role

As the Product Marketing Manager (PMM) you are responsible for establishing product positioning and messaging, use cases and corresponding content that illustrate product differentiation and drive demand and consumption of Reprise demo creation offerings. You‚Äôll constantly be collaborating with the Leadership, Product, Marketing and Sales teams to implement and execute a successful product go-to-market (GTM) plan and roadmap strategy and produce the essential content required to activate internal and external audiences. You'll be an expert on our product, our customers, the market and competitive landscape.

You‚Äôll be particularly focused on partnering with members of the Marketing team to ensure a successful integrated marketing approach and you‚Äôll work across our Sales and Customer Success teams to meet and exceed revenue and customer goals.

In this role, you can expect to:
  • Strategize on and execute product marketing efforts including: collaboration on positioning, messaging, GTM strategy and customer intelligence
  • Develop a deep understanding of the portfolio of offerings, features, use cases, audiences and the markets in which we compete
  • Constantly collaborate with the Product team to understand and articulate the roadmap, communicate and enable the Sales and Customer Success teams on the value proposition of the offering and features (messaging, key benefits, buyer personas, competitor battle cards, etc.)
  • Partner with Marketing and Sales teams to understand the sales process, opportunities and challenges and deliver content to support growth, including: messaging, competitive positioning, use cases, demos, web content and blogs
  • Identify opportunities to expose the Reprise offerings in a transparent and value-led way to generate awareness and convert leads
  • Analyze internal product and customer data; conduct and share regular assessments on competitive landscape, conduct interviews with our customers and prospects, influence the product roadmap and sales strategy
  • Communicate all of the above through internal enablement and external communications that support demand generation, customer expansion and renewal efforts
Required Skills
  • Passion for working in a dynamic, high-growth environment
  • 5+ years of product marketing experience in B2B SaaS market
  • Growth hacking skills to constantly understand buyer needs, identify opportunities to showcase differentiation, rapidly build demos to illustrate solutions, simplicity and impact
  • Customer-first focus to present solutions, create content and educate buyers
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with both internal teams and especially with prospects and customers.¬† You've had experience with and excel at writing blog posts, customer presentations, launch communications, use cases, etc.
  • Experience developing and implementing go-to-market programs for a growing B2B SaaS company
  • Experience contributing to and leading customer research, analyst outreach, positioning, segmentation, and messaging of new and existing products into market
  • Adaptability to work and excel in an early stage startup. Our processes change week over week, so does the product. Does that excite you or stress you out?
  • A continuous improvement mindset that understands things are constantly changing, and is passionate about helping them change for the better. We are entrusting you to see that. If something is not working, you fix it. If you can't fix it, tell someone who can.
  • Raw wattage to think and learn quickly in a fast-paced startup environment

Benefits:

  • A competitive salary for the market
  • Early stage equity for all employees
  • Open vacation policy¬†
  • Health, Vision, Dental Insurance Options, FSA/HSA Options, OneMedical membership included
  • 401(k)
  • Long and short term disability
  • The ability to work anywhere in the US - we are a 100% remote company (even prior to COVID)
  • Joining an experienced, multiple-previous-startups crew

In accordance with Reprise‚Äôs duty to provide and maintain a workplace that is free of known hazards, we have adopted a mandatory vaccination policy to safeguard the health of our employees and their families, our customers and visitors, and the community at large, from infectious diseases such as COVID-19, that may be reduced by vaccinations.This policy complies with all applicable laws and is based on guidance from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and local health authorities, as applicable. As such, all employees, with the exception of those who have a medical or religious exemption, must show proof of vaccination within their first 30 days of employment with Reprise.

At Reprise we believe that startups have the responsibility to progress equity in the workplace and beyond. We are not just committed to, but passionate about building a diverse and inclusive work environment. Every candidate seeking to join Reprise is provided an equal opportunity for employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, citizenship, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status.

results.title: Head of Search Engine Marketing (German Speaking)
results.description:
Libertex Europe Overview

Part of the Libertex Group, Libertex is an online broker offering CFDs trading with underlying assets being commodities, Forex, ETFs, cryptocurrencies, and others. Libertex also offers investments in real stocks.

Over the years, Libertex has received more than 40 prestigious international awards and recognitions, including ‚ÄúBest CFD Broker Europe‚Äù (Global Brands Magazine, 2022) and ‚ÄúMost Trusted Broker in Europe‚Äù (Ultimate Fintech Awards, 2021. Libertex is the Official Online Trading Partner of FC Bayern and Tottenham Hotspur, bringing the exciting worlds of football and trading together.

Since being founded in 1997, the Libertex Group has grown into a diverse group of companies, serving millions of clients from several countries all over the world.

The Libertex trading platform is used by Indication Investments Ltd a Cyprus Investment Firm regulated and supervised by the Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission (CySEC) with CIF License number 164/12.

Job Overview

We are looking for a Head of Search Engine Marketing (SEM) who is native in German language. This role focuses on direct response advertising. KPIs for you are measured almost instantly, allowing you to be extremely agile and data driven. Our decisions are based on ROI that makes the role high-impact and high-visibility. For most marketers, it‚Äôs intimidating, but enticing to you!

Main Responsibilities

  • Creating, developing & implementing effective long- and short-term paid search strategies with good ROAS
  • Managing PPC budgets, while strengthening platform accounts and key client relationships
  • Executing & optimizing multiple PPC campaigns simultaneously
  • Overseeing web and mobile campaigns across a number of search platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Apple Search Ads)
  • Targeting selected groups through keyword and audience research
  • Managing and editing campaign budgets and adjusting bids to optimize ROAS
  • Tracking daily, weekly & monthly KPIs to identify opportunities for improvement or more efficient spending
  • Reporting KPIs to management on a regular basis via various dashboards
  • Producing engaging, clear, and concise copy for campaigns
  • Reducing risk of click fraud and irrelevant spend
  • Staying up to date with PPC/SEM trends and techniques and applying them where relevant

Requirements

  • Degree in Marketing, Digital Media or any other related field, with Google Ads certification is a plus
  • Minimum 3 years' experience as a PPC Manager or Digital Marketing Specialist focused on SEM
  • Native in German language and fluency in English language ‚Äì reading, speaking & writing
  • Experience with multiple platforms, e.g., AdWords, Apple Search Ads, Bing
  • Ability to lead a remote team of professionals
  • Proven team leading or managerial skills with management of remote teams
  • Strong analytical and numeracy skills
  • Confident translating large amounts of data into comprehensible or visual reports
  • Expertise using and manipulating paid search dashboards to optimize spend
  • Confident using Google Analytics or similar tools
  • Excellent communication, both verbal and written, and experience presenting reports and optimizations

Benefits

  • 25 working days annual leave + Germany Public Holidays
  • Comprehensive Global Medical Insurance Plan, with coverage for the employee and their immediate family from day one
  • Udemy for Business Unlimited Membership
  • Ongoing professional and personal development

results.title: Senior Marketing & Communications Lead
results.description:
About Tre'dish¬†

The hospitality industry is fundamentally broken, with people working incredibly long and uncertain hours, on low wages, with huge overheads. Tre'dish is reinventing this industry by empowering people around the world to create successful businesses right from their own home. All you need is one great recipe, and we provide you with everything required to become a successful food entrepreneur; turning your kitchen into a steady income stream, while establishing your brand both digitally and throughout your community.¬†¬†

We have launched locations in California and will be expanding our SAAS platform and affiliated marketplace across North America in the coming months with Canada being our core focus area.¬†¬†

You can watch a short video explaining our business model here, and find out more about us at https://tredish.com/about and https://www.forbes.com/sites/davidprosser/2021/11/03/how-tredish-plans-to-empower-a-worldwide-army-of-home-chefs/?sh=2765a78e2884¬†

¬†

About the Role¬†

We're looking for a Senior Marketing and Communications Lead to join Tre'dish and help launch an exciting purpose driven brand to multiple markets within Canada and the US with the GTA being our key initial launch region. You'll be working closely with the leadership team, a small marketing and content team and other stakeholders to help design and execute our marketing and communications strategy. The key focus will be the execution of an omni channel campaign strategy to ensure our impact thesis and value proposition receives earned media attention and every touch point with our marketing, digital, customer acquisition and loyalty campaigns are fully connected and integrated.¬†

We are a fully remote team with colleagues across North America with our main presence and team being located in Toronto and Mississauga, ON.¬†¬†¬†

¬†

What You'll Do
  • Help develop and execute some of our most exciting marketing and content properties with a key focus on building and launching a national philanthropic impact-entrepreneurship marketing & sponsorship campaign¬†
  • Work alongside a team of advisors, agencies, and internal team members to build and execute our omni channel campaign and marketing strategy¬†
  • Design, launch & optimize tactics and experiments across the funnel to effectively scale results¬†
  • Measure and refine key KPIs and tracking metrics associated with campaign success to influence future decision making¬†
What We're Looking For
  • Proven experience in omni channel marketing; including digital, experiential, demand generation, customer acquisition, retention & loyalty and marketing communications (championing our brand voice)¬†
  • Experience launching a new product or property, campaign planning & execution, goal setting, and building marketing roadmaps¬†
  • Mission driven individuals who care about delivering impact. Our team is built with individuals who care about solving issues in hospitality including;¬†creating new hospitality careers, creating accessible and affordable food, and empowering small business owners¬†
  • An outside-of-the-box thinker that brings creative ideas to the table¬†
  • Comfortable working and collaborating in cross functional teams; integrating yourself within a team of marketers, engineers, chefs & food industry professionals, designers, data scientists, etc.¬†
  • Self-motivated, comfortable working independently and a desire to learn quickly and take risks¬†
Bonus, if you have experience:¬†
  • In an impact-driven organization or early startup culture¬†
  • Supporting and/or managing PR campaigns & partners, specifically leading comms and ensuring connectivity to omni-channel marketing campaigns¬†
  • Working alongside product & design teams to optimize user journeys and create world-class user experiences¬†
  • Understanding of web & mobile analytics, paid media campaign development & management¬†
  • Planning & executing on social platforms. Including, but not limited to: TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube¬†
  • Building and executing B2B marketing, account-based marketing, channel marketing, and/or partnership marketing strategies¬†¬†

We are looking for a talented individual who cares about empowering the next generation of food entrepreneurs and providing an incredible experience for our customers and partners. This is a special opportunity to build a platform and movement impacting millions of lives and changing the world for the better.¬†

We believe our team should be as diverse as the entrepreneurs and customers we work with. There's zero judgement when it comes to the things that make you who you are ‚Äì whether that's your gender, race, religion or sexuality. If you feel you'd be good at the job, please reach out to us.¬†

results.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
results.description:

results.title: Marketing Manager
results.description:
We are seeking a creative yet structured Marketing Manager to grow our marketing engine and change the way people with chronic conditions receive care. In this remote role, you will be critical in developing and running high-performing campaigns that drive qualified B2B leads, with a strong bias towards rapid iteration and experimentation. You will be responsible for creating and executing growth marketing campaigns and brand strategy across email, direct mail, paid media, sponsorships, and events to fill our sales funnel.¬†

Who is Better Health?

Better Health is a new type of medical provider built on peer to peer connection, helping people with chronic conditions live and age at home. We bundle peer support, education, and home delivery of medical supplies in an end-to-end digital care solution. We help our members discover and purchase the best medical equipment and supplies to address their underlying chronic conditions and receive the education and support they need to thrive at home.¬†

Since our inception in November 2019, Better Health has gained Medicare licenses in 46 states, 16 Medicaid licenses, and preferred national provider contracts with leading payers, including Oscar Health and Humana. This has allowed our member base to rapidly grow with virtually no churn. We are backed by Caffeinated Capital, General Catalyst, Mastry, 8VC, Bill Ackman and¬† a large group of experienced investors and entrepreneurs (see our series A announcement post).¬†

So, what will you do as our Marketing Manager?

  • Be the right-hand person to our head of marketing for everything marketing related in Better Health ‚Äî you will be involved in setting the strategy, experimenting with new channels, executing programs, and measuring success
  • Develop value propositions, messaging, and go-to-market assets that drive demand with our target audiences of health insurance companies (payers), healthcare providers, and patients
  • Collaborate with internal teams on member marketing & communications, implementing campaigns across email, SMS, and direct mail
  • Develop content marketing and website presence that resonates with our prospects¬†
  • Ensure marketing efforts are measurable and performing. Develop and evaluate reports and extract key insights that impact our website, marketing goals, and sales funnel
  • Ensure consistent branding across the company, maintaining and disseminating style guides and asset library¬†
  • Manage vendors and freelancers to drive on-brand and effective marketing deliverables
  • Brainstorm with teams to develop creative solutions and growth strategies

Sounds exciting? We‚Äôre interested in YOU if this sounds like you:¬†

  • You like to be involved in everything so you can use your broad range of skills, from developing value propositions and writing high-impact copy, to creating growth campaigns and marketing analytics that report on success¬†
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, can pivot quickly, with relentless followthrough
  • Have 3-7 years of experience in B2B marketing, at a fast-growing startup, healthcare a big plus
  • Are a proven builder of high-performing marketing campaigns and programs, with demonstrated success rolling out content marketing initiatives¬†
  • Ability to tell a succinct, meaningful, and actionable story with data using visualization and other techniques
  • Ability and insight to drive improvements in design, traffic, and website content.
  • Adept with aspects of digital marketing like SEO, marketing automation, and email marketing, but also know how to explore/develop new marketing channels
  • Communicative and solutions-oriented ‚Äî You are the first to flag an issue and have already thought of potential solutions¬†
  • Outcomes driven ‚Äî You focus on the end goal, reporting on the so-what and the impact, not just the activity
  • Analytical with a narrative ‚Äî You think like a journalist. Excellent researcher, ask the right questions, focus on metrics, and can extract insights from data to tell a powerful story.¬†
  • Familiar with MixPanel, Google Analytics, LinkedIn Campaign Manager.¬†

Now, why choose Better Health?

For starters, our benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + equity package
  • Healthcare & Dental¬†
  • Flexible PTO
  • Full remote flexibility¬†
  • Joining a team driven to improving the lives of those living with chronic conditions

But most importantly, here at Better Health, our mission is to bring information, access, and support to people managing chronic conditions at home. Our diverse team is united by our shared values:

  • Open dialogue with radical transparency
  • Creativity to run with ideas
  • Collaboration across teams

If you're fired up at the thought of revitalizing a tired $60 billion industry and passionate about user-focused solutions, join us!

¬†---

Better Health is committed to being an employer that provides not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. To that end, we strive to recruit and maintain a workforce that meaningfully represents the diverse and culturally rich communities that we serve. results.title: Director of Product Marketing
results.description:
At Nova Credit, our mission is to power a more fair and inclusive financial system for the world.¬†Nova Credit‚Äôs diverse global team is stitching together the world's credit data into a single network to unlock financial opportunities for immigrants and other populations historically excluded from the credit system. We‚Äôve built a platform that enables lenders to access a single, predictive cross-border credit database to help enable underwriting decisions. We are backed by leading investors including Kleiner Perkins, General Catalyst, and Index Ventures.
¬†
Nova Credit works with some of the world‚Äôs preeminent firms in the credit sector. Our unique product position generates value for a diverse set of constituents, including thousands of consumers, public corporations, and various financial & technology partners globally. This privileged position creates a unique opportunity for marketing to generate significant growth opportunities through a variety of strategies by working closely with leaders across various organizations.¬†
¬†
We‚Äôre looking for a Director of Product Marketing to elevate our brand and product position into a sophisticated, enterprise-grade offering to enable our GTM function to enter hyper-growth. In this role you will fully own the strategy and execution of the entire product marketing function, focusing on building a cohesive B2B narrative for our two (and future) products, solidifying our position as leaders in our product categories, developing exceptional thought leadership, and enabling our sales and marketing campaigns with content that moves our target consumer. At the same time, you will oversee the product marketing strategy for our D2C motion, as we continue to grow our affiliate revenue and expand our existing accounts under the same Nova Credit brand.
¬†
This is a full-time role on the Marketing Team, reporting directly to Nova Credit‚Äôs VP of Marketing.



RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Elevate Nova Credit‚Äôs brand and product assets to position the company as a leading, enterprise-grade financial technology provider
  • Provide strategic direction for our product marketing function as well as create a cross-functional view of marketing initiatives and campaigns
  • Maintain strong cross-functional relationships and work streams with Product, Revenue, and Engineering to execute product assets and campaigns¬†
  • Build exceptional thought leadership content that (1) educates our prospects/customers, (2) positions Nova Credit at the forefront of the cash flow underwriting movement, and (3) solidifies our expertise in the new-to-country credit market¬†
  • Own and maintain our portfolio of marketing assets, including website, landing pages, sales collateral (below), videos, and more
  • Create collateral that helps our sales team win deals, including pitch decks, one-pagers, proposal documents, use cases, case studies, email copy, and other educational materials¬†
  • Develop a robust framework for maintaining and democratizing product messaging and collateral¬†
  • Leverage product and industry expertise (via customer feedback, user research, GTM market analysis, etc.) to continuously drive customers‚Äô product competency and usage
  • Understand our customers‚Äô needs at a granular level, unearthing the most critical pain points, and be their voice throughout all marketing assets and campaigns
  • Lead product launches and strategic marketing efforts¬†
  • Routinely measure the success of assets and leverage insights to influence future GTM roadmaps¬†



YOUR SKILLSET:
  • Proven experience working with senior leads in a cross-functional capacity to drive projects to completion with a high degree of excellence
  • Experience building product marketing teams and managing various skill sets such as creative, content development, writing, editorial, product management, and design
  • Vision and creativity for impactful storytelling¬†
  • Comfortable working with B2B and D2C audiences, simultaneously
  • Strong project management skills; results-focused with impactful execution and follow-through; highly detail-oriented
  • Ability to translate highly technical B2B products into crisp customer-facing narratives with a focus on driving product education and usage¬†
  • Experience working with early-stage technology companies selling to different customer profiles; ideally in a fast-paced environment; fintech experience preferred
  • 8+ years of B2B product marketing experience
¬†
We consider all elements of compensation as a part of the value we provide to Novans. This may include base salary, equity grants, incentive compensation for eligible roles, professional development, flexible PTO, and tenure rewards. We offer U.S.-based Novans competitive, employer-subsidized medical, dental, and vision plans, in addition to mental health and wellness benefits and a range of other benefits & perks.
